A **potion of healing** is a type of [potion](/wiki/Potion "Potion") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Description](#Description)

- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [4 History](#History)

- [5 Messages](#Messages)

- [6 Variants](#Variants)

  - [6.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [6.2 NetHack Fourk](#NetHack_Fourk)
  - [6.3 SlashTHEM](#SlashTHEM)

- [7 References](#References)

## Generation

All [Healers](/wiki/Healer "Healer") start the game with 4 non-cursed potions of healing, and all [Monks](/wiki/Monk "Monk") start the game with 3 non-cursed potions of healing.

[Intelligent](/wiki/Intelligent "Intelligent") monsters may [generate with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") a potion of healing as a [defensive item](/wiki/Defensive_item "Defensive item"). [Shopkeepers](/wiki/Shopkeeper "Shopkeeper") have a separate 3⁄4 chance of being generated with one.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

The inventory of health food [shops](/wiki/Shop "Shop") has a 1⁄25 chance of containing a potion of healing on a given square.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Per [commit 62fb8759](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/62fb87593189311927746f0bfe21e317c1838c69), the potion of healing is much more common.

## Description

[Quaffing](/wiki/Quaff "Quaff") the potion will [heal](/wiki/Healing "Healing") you and [exercise](/wiki/Exercise "Exercise") [constitution](/wiki/Constitution "Constitution"), with the amount healed dependent on [beatitude](/wiki/Beatitude "Beatitude"): a blessed potion of healing will heal you for 8d4 [HP](/wiki/HP "HP"), an uncursed one for 6d4, and a cursed one for 4d4. If quaffing a non-cursed potion would restore your HP above maximum, your maximum HP is also increase by 1. Non-cursed potions cure [blindness](/wiki/Blindness "Blindness") and [deafness](/wiki/Deafness "Deafness"), and blessed ones also cure [vomiting](/wiki/Vomiting "Vomiting") and [sickness](/wiki/Sickness "Sickness").

Monsters can also quaff the potion to heal for the same amount, though it can only additionally cure blindness (if noncursed); monsters hit by the potion are fully healed and, if the potion was blessed, are also unblinded.[\[3\]](#cite_note-3) Pestilence is damaged by the potion, but the effects will always be completely resisted unless Pestilence is severely [level drained](/wiki/Level_drain "Level drain") first.[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)

Inhaling [vapors](/wiki/Vapors "Vapors") from a potion of healing of any [beatitude](/wiki/Beatitude "Beatitude") will heal 1 HP, cure blindness and [deafness](/wiki/Deaf "Deaf") if it was blessed, and exercise constitution; if you are [polymorphed](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph"), the health of your base form is adjusted as well.[\[5\]](#cite_note-5)

You can use a potion of healing in [alchemy](/wiki/Alchemy "Alchemy") by dipping (or dipping into) potions of [gain level](/wiki/Potion_of_gain_level "Potion of gain level"), [gain energy](/wiki/Potion_of_gain_energy "Potion of gain energy"), or [speed](/wiki/Potion_of_speed "Potion of speed") to get a [potion of extra healing](/wiki/Potion_of_extra_healing "Potion of extra healing"). Dipping a [poisoned](/wiki/Poison "Poison") weapon into a potion of healing will remove the poison and use up the potion.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

As of [commit 09cf4648](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/09cf464816e4c44618cb3880edc0f7146e5b9b1e), the potion of healing heals more HP on average: 8+6d4 if blessed, 8+4d4 if uncursed, 8+2d4 if cursed.

## Strategy

The potion of healing is a decent resource for starting and early character; spellcasters are typically better off using the [healing](/wiki/Spellbook_of_healing "Spellbook of healing") spell in most situations unless they are aiming to conserve power or reduce the weight of their inventory. Later in the game, when the potion's healing is less effective, you should consider alchemizing them into potions of extra healing, and then to [full healing](/wiki/Potion_of_full_healing "Potion of full healing") if possible. If saving [speed](/wiki/Potion_of_speed "Potion of speed") potions for use in the late stages of the game, and/or reserving your other alchemy components for full healing potions, you can instead [wield](/wiki/Wield "Wield") or [throw](/wiki/Throw "Throw") healing potions at your pets, which always restores them to full health (although this is still considered [abuse](/wiki/Abuse "Abuse")).

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Commit 62fb875 also changed the and its base price is changed to 20, which is unique for potions and makes informal identification easier.

## History

The potion of healing first appears in Hack 1.21, which is based on [Jay Fenlason's Hack](/wiki/Jay_Fenlason%27s_Hack "Jay Fenlason's Hack") - Hack 1.21 also has the potion of extra hit points, whose functions are effectively folded into the various healing potions included in Hack for PDP-11 and PDX. The potion of healing appears in the initial item list for [Hack 1.0](/wiki/Hack_1.0 "Hack 1.0").

## Messages

- [You feel](/wiki/You_feel "You feel") better.

  You quaffed a potion of healing.

- <[Foo](/wiki/Foo "Foo")> looks better.

  A monster quaffed a potion of healing.

- \<Foo> looks sound and hale again.

  A monster was hit with a potion of healing.

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), two potions of healing can be found in the outside area of [Grund's Stronghold](/wiki/Grund%27s_Stronghold "Grund's Stronghold").

### NetHack Fourk

In [NetHack Fourk](/wiki/NetHack_Fourk "NetHack Fourk"), all non-Healer [sylphs](/wiki/Sylph_\(starting_race\) "Sylph (starting race)") start with a potion of healing; sylph Healers are given a [magic harp](/wiki/Magic_harp "Magic harp") in place of the extra potion.

### SlashTHEM

In [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM"), in addition to SLASH'EM details, making a potion of healing using a [chemistry set](/wiki/Chemistry_set "Chemistry set") takes two charges.

3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [src/muse.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 958](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/muse.c#L958)
4. [↑](#cite_ref-4) [src/potion.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1429](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/potion.c#L1429): *Healing potions do [potion of sickness](/wiki/Potion_of_sickness "Potion of sickness") effects to Pestilence, subject to Pestilence's 100 [monster magic resistance](/wiki/Monster_magic_resistance "Monster magic resistance"). This means that Pestilence needs to be drained below level 6 for the potions to have a few percent chance of affecting Pestilence.*
5. [↑](#cite_ref-5) [src/potion.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1667](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/potion.c#L1667)
